messages.text: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
messages.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

messages.text: I am not free while any woman is unfree.
messages.author: Audre Lorde

messages.text: You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them.
messages.author: Maya Angelou

messages.text: Above all, be the heroine of your life, not the victim.
messages.author: Nora Ephron

messages.text: One is not born, but rather becomes, a woman.
messages.author: Simone de Beauvoir

messages.text: I dwell in possibility.
messages.author: Emily Dickinson

messages.text: Love is an act of endless forgiveness.
messages.author: Maya Angelou

messages.text: Freedom is always freedom of dissenters.
messages.author: Rosa Luxemburg

messages.text: Be reckless in your love.
messages.author: Mary Oliver

messages.text: Hope is the thing with feathers.
messages.author: Emily Dickinson

messages.text: Nothing succeeds like excess.
messages.author: Mae West

messages.text: I raise up my voice not so that I can shout, but so that those without a voice can be heard.
messages.author: Malala Yousafzai

messages.text: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
messages.author: Alice Walker

messages.text: A woman without a man is like a fish without a bicycle.
messages.author: Irina Dunn

messages.text: Do one thing every day that scares you.
messages.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

messages.text: I am deliberate and afraid of nothing.
messages.author: Audre Lorde

messages.text: If you obey all the rules, you miss all the fun.
messages.author: Katharine Hepburn

messages.text: You can't use up creativity. The more you use, the more you have.
messages.author: Maya Angelou

messages.text: I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.
messages.author: Louisa May Alcott

messages.text: Think like a queen. A queen is not afraid to fail.
messages.author: Oprah Winfrey

messages.text: I can be changed by what happens to me. But I refuse to be reduced by it.
messages.author: Maya Angelou

messages.text: The question isn't who's going to let me. It's who's going to stop me.
messages.author: Ayn Rand

messages.text: No need to hurry. No need to sparkle. No need to be anybody but oneself.
messages.author: Virginia Woolf

messages.text: I took a deep breath and listened to the old brag of my heart. I am, I am, I am.
messages.author: Sylvia Plath

messages.text: I am not free while any woman is unfree, even when her shackles are very different from my own.
messages.author: Audre Lorde

messages.text: A woman with a voice is by definition a strong woman.
messages.author: Melinda Gates

messages.text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
messages.author: George Eliot

messages.text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
messages.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

messages.text: To tell the truth is revolutionary.
messages.author: Rosa Luxemburg

messages.text: I am rooted, but I flow.
messages.author: Virginia Woolf

messages.text: We delight in the beauty of the butterfly, but rarely admit the changes it has gone through.
messages.author: Maya Angelou

messages.text: The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.
messages.author: Coco Chanel

messages.text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
messages.author: Anaïs Nin

messages.text: Nothing can dim the light that shines from within.
messages.author: Maya Angelou

messages.text: I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the waters.
messages.author: Mother Teresa

messages.text: If you don't risk anything, you risk even more.
messages.author: Erica Jong

messages.text: I am not afraid of storms.
messages.author: Louisa May Alcott

messages.text: You are allowed to be both a masterpiece and a work in progress.
messages.author: Sophia Bush

messages.text: If you don't like being a doormat, get off the floor.
messages.author: Al Anon saying (attributed to women speakers)

messages.text: The best protection any woman can have is courage.
messages.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

messages.text: Power is not given to you. You have to take it.
messages.author: Beyoncé Knowles

messages.text: My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive.
messages.author: Maya Angelou

messages.text: I am grateful for being a woman.
messages.author: Maya Angelou

messages.text: A girl should be two things: who and what she wants.
messages.author: Coco Chanel

messages.text: You can waste your lives drawing lines. Or you can live your life crossing them.
messages.author: Shonda Rhimes

messages.text: I am thankful for my struggle because without it I wouldn't have stumbled across my strength.
messages.author: Alex Elle

messages.text: I want to be in the arena. I want to be brave with my life.
messages.author: Brené Brown

messages.text: Courage starts with showing up and letting ourselves be seen.
messages.author: Brené Brown

messages.text: Vulnerability is the birthplace of love, belonging, joy, courage.
messages.author: Brené Brown

messages.text: I will not have my life narrowed down.
messages.author: Bell Hooks

messages.text: Love is a combination of care, commitment, knowledge, responsibility, respect and trust.
messages.author: Bell Hooks

messages.text: The thing women have yet to learn is nobody gives you power. You just take it.
messages.author: Roseanne Barr

messages.text: I can promise you women working together link arms and become unstoppable.
messages.author: Michelle Obama

messages.text: There is no limit to what we, as women, can accomplish.
messages.author: Michelle Obama

messages.text: Do not bring people in your life who weigh you down.
messages.author: Oprah Winfrey

messages.text: You get in life what you have the courage to ask for.
messages.author: Oprah Winfrey

messages.text: When women support each other, incredible things happen.
messages.author: Unknown (modern feminist aphorism)

messages.text: I am mine before I am ever anyone else's.
messages.author: Nayyirah Waheed

messages.text: And still, I rise.
messages.author: Maya Angelou

messages.text: You must do the thing you think you cannot do.
messages.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

messages.text: I want my life to be messy and fierce.
messages.author: Shonda Rhimes

messages.text: The strongest actions for a woman is to love herself.
messages.author: Unknown (attributed to women writers)

messages.text: You are your best thing.
messages.author: Toni Morrison

messages.text: Definitions belong to the definers, not the defined.
messages.author: Toni Morrison

messages.text: I write to discover what I know.
messages.author: Flannery O'Connor

messages.text: The most revolutionary thing one can do is always to proclaim loudly what is happening.
messages.author: Rosa Luxemburg

messages.text: If we don't define ourselves for ourselves, we will be defined by others.
messages.author: Audre Lorde

messages.text: I am deliberate and afraid of nothing.
messages.author: Audre Lorde

messages.text: Care is the antidote to violence.
messages.author: Bell Hooks

messages.text: The most radical thing a woman can do is speak the truth.
messages.author: Unknown (modern feminist aphorism)

messages.text: Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?
messages.author: Mary Oliver

messages.text: When I dare to be powerful, I use my strength in the service of my vision.
messages.author: Audre Lorde

messages.text: If you don't like the road you're walking, start paving another one.
messages.author: Dolly Parton

messages.text: Find out who you are and do it on purpose.
messages.author: Dolly Parton

messages.text: If you can dance and be free and not be embarrassed, you can rule the world.
messages.author: Amy Poehler

messages.text: Good for her.
messages.author: Amy Poehler

messages.text: You are not required to set yourself on fire to keep other people warm.
messages.author: Unknown (often attributed to women advocates)

messages.text: I am learning to trust the journey.
messages.author: Alex Elle

messages.text: You can carve your own path.
messages.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

messages.text: Fight for the things that you care about.
messages.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

messages.text: Women belong in all places where decisions are being made.
messages.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

messages.text: Real change, enduring change, happens one step at a time.
messages.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

messages.text: You should never let your fears prevent you from doing what you know is right.
messages.author: Aung San Suu Kyi

messages.text: Each of us has a fire in our hearts.
messages.author: Joan of Arc

messages.text: The future belongs to those who prepare for it today.
messages.author: Malala Yousafzai

messages.text: I do not wish women to have power over men; but over themselves.
messages.author: Mary Wollstonecraft

messages.text: We are not what we know but what we are willing to learn.
messages.author: Mary Catherine Bateson

messages.text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
messages.author: Jane Addams

messages.text: We have to believe in free will. We have no choice.
messages.author: Hannah Arendt

messages.text: There is nothing stronger than a broken woman who has rebuilt herself.
messages.author: Hannah Gadsby

messages.text: Do the best you can until you know better. Then when you know better, do better.
messages.author: Maya Angelou

messages.text: You are more powerful than you know.
messages.author: Gloria Steinem

messages.text: Without leaps of imagination, we lose the excitement of possibility.
messages.author: Madeleine L'Engle

messages.text: The most effective way to do it is to do it.
messages.author: Amelia Earhart

messages.text: I have learned not to allow rejection to move me.
messages.author: Cicely Tyson

messages.text: Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.
messages.author: Mother Teresa

messages.text: There is no gate, no lock, no bolt that you can set upon the freedom of my mind.
messages.author: Virginia Woolf

messages.text: If you want something said, ask a man. If you want something done, ask a woman.
messages.author: Margaret Thatcher

messages.text: I am grateful to be a woman.
messages.author: Maya Angelou
